title: High school sports Monday’s results
text:
Published: Tue, October 6, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Poland 7, Niles 0 
NILES 
Poland’s seven goals were scored by Joe Shields, Marcus Trevis, Matthew Holsinger, Reed McCreery, and Matt Slepski, with Shields and Holsinger both scoring twice. Trey Medvec, Trevis, and Holsinger all contributed assists. Bryan Montgomery had one save in the shutout for Poland, and Eric Pappada had 15 saves for Niles. 
South Range 2, Salem 0 
SALEM 
Brandon Youngs scored both goals for South Range, and the Raiders goalkeeper Brant Rothbauer had five saves for the shutout. Salem goalkeeper Cody Ewing made 10 saves. 
Lordstown 4, Badger 2 
KINSMAN 
Garrett Behner scored three goals for Lordstown, and the final goal was scored by Michon Peterson. Both Behner and Peterson had assists, and Ethan Radtka contributed the other two assists. Collin Himes had three saves for Lordstown. For Badger, Garrett Kellogg scored both goals, and Matthew Hecker tallied 13 saves. Lordstown is currently 10-3-1, and tied for first in NAC. 
GIRLS SOCCER 
Canfield 3, Boardman 1 
BOARDMAN 
Ana Kilbert scored the first goal for Canfield (11-0-1) off an assist from Haylee Klacik. Klacik went on to score the second goal with an assist from Elizabeth Pilloli, and the third goal was scored by an own goal. Olivia VanDevender had two saves for Canfield. Boardman’s only goal was scored by Sara Downie, and Camille Holzschuh had 14 saves for the Spartans. JV: Canfield 7, Boardman 1. 
South Range 3, Beaver Local 3 
LISBON 
Mackenzie Ferenchak scored two goals for the Raiders, and Casey Lindstrom scored one. Kameron Hobbs and Rachel Maynard each contributed an assist for South Range as well. No stats were reported for Beaver Local. 
Howland 3, Harding 0 
WARREN 
Isabella Merlo, Leah Pollifrone, and Sara Ciletti scored Howland’s goals with assists from Napier Ramsey and Morgan Scott. Kamryn Buckley made three saves for Howland, after which Ariel Takat stepped in to play and made one save. Bella Vankirk and India Stovell both played in goal for Harding, with Vankirk recording five saves and Stovell making one. Howland is now 6-6-2. JV: Howland 2, Harding 0. 
Poland 2, Hubbard 1 
POLAND 
Jessica Miller and Brianna Stackpole both scored for Poland. Marissa Grande scored the lone goal for Hubbard. JV: Poland, 6-0. 
Salem 0, Springfield 0 
The teams played to a scoreless tie. Quakers goalie Katie Moore recorded seven saves. 
Niles 7, Edgewood 0 
ASHTABULA TOWNSHIP 
Bethany Rasile and Hannah Ward each scored two goals and tallied three assists as Niles (10-2-1) downed Edgewood. Kameron Delvecchio, Madison McGuire and Bella Reigle also recorded goals for the Red Dragons, while Jaycee Ward recorded an assist. Brittany Kendzerski had 20 saves for Edgewood. JV: Niles 4, Edgewood 0. 
Warren JFK 4, Valley Christian 3 
YOUNGSTOWN 
No stats were reported for this game. 
VOLLEYBALL 
Ursuline 25-25-25, East 21-18-21 
YOUNGSTOWN 
Ursuline’s leaders were Destiny Goodnight with 16 points and 12 kills, Julianna Kratzer with 15 digs, and Madison Kelly with 17 assists. For Youngstown East, Myra Taylor had seven points and one ace, and Honay Ingram also contributed five points and an ace. JV: Ursuline 2, East 0. 
Cardinal Mooney 25-25-25, Hubbard 13-18-16 
YOUNGSTOWN 
For Mooney (12-4), Maddie Abrigg had 14 kills, Autumb DeSantis had four blocks, Maria Pelini had 21 assists, and Marcella Adams had 18 digs and 4 aces. For the Eagles (4-10), Kristen Fahndrich had 16 digs, Addy Jarvis had nine kills, and Emily Krinos had 17 assists. JV: Mooney 2, Hubbard 1. 
Warren Harding 25-25-25, Edgewood 13-21-22 
WARREN 
The leaders for Harding were Kristin Sampson with 13 points and 23 assists, Allyson Crays with 4 aces, Shymara Dykes with 11 kills and 5 blocks, and Bryna Jenkins with 10 digs. For Edgewood, Savannah Flick had 13 points, 12 aces, and 19 digs, Iesha Niciv had 14 kills, and Ashley Evans had 19 assists. JV: Edgewood 2, WGH 1.= 
Howland 25-25-18-25, Poland 23-19-25-13 
HOWLAND 
Cassie Murcko led the Tigers (9-9) with 25 kills and Lexi Miner recorded 39 assists as Howland downed Poland (11-8). Cordray Sundstrom paced the Bulldogs with 10 kills, while Jen Eich notched 19 assists, 13 points and three aces. Maria Nuzzi also led Howland with 13 points and two assists. JV: Howland, 2-1. 
Staff reports
